title: Client​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> JoinRequest.Client: Client A reference back to the client that owns this object.

title: Requester​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> JoinRequest.Requester: User The user that made the request.

title: Created​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> JoinRequest.Created: number When the join request was made (unix time).

title: __call ​
content: </> JoinRequest.__call ( _: JoinRequest, Client: Client,-- The client to make requests with. GroupId: Group | number,-- The Group or GroupId the join request is for. UserId: User | number,-- The User or UserId that made the join request. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → JoinRequest? Constructs a JoinRequest object, returns nil if there is no join request by that user for the group.

title: Accept ​
content: </> JoinRequest:Accept () → boolean Accepts the join request, allowing the user into the group. Returns if the operation was successful.

title: Decline ​
content: </> JoinRequest:Decline () → boolean Declines the join request. Returns if the operation was successful.

title: __call ​
content: </> Member.__call ( _: Member, Client: Client,-- The client to make requests with. GroupId: Group | number,-- The Group or GroupId the member belongs to. UserId: User | number,-- The User or UserId the member object represents. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Member Constructs a member object. This will return nil if the user is not in the group.

title: GetRole ​
content: </> Member:GetRole () → Role? Gets the role of the member in the group.

title: SetRole ​
content: </> Member:SetRole ( Role: Role | number-- The Role or RoleId to set the user to. ) → ( boolean, string? ) Sets the role of the member in the group. Returns if the operation was successful, and if it wasn't, it returns the reason.

title: Exile ​
content: </> Member:Exile () → ( boolean, string? ) Exiles the member from the group. Returns if the operation was successful, and if it wasn't, it returns the reason.

title: PageCursor ​
content: </> Client:PageCursor ( Endpoint: string,-- The endpoint to get pages from. Tags: {[string]=any},-- Optional list of tags to add on to the request. Interpret: function,-- The function that interprets recieved data, to turn it into a useable format. SortOrder: string?,-- The sort order to use when requesting for pages. Can be "Asc" or "Desc". Limit: number?,-- The page item limit to use when requesting pages. PageDataLocation: string?,-- The location where page data is located for non-standard pages. PageNextLocation: string?,-- The location where the next page cursor is found for non-standard pages. PagePreviousLocation: string?,-- The location where the previous page cursor is found for non-standard pages. CursorTag: string?,-- The name of the tag to send the cursor for non-standard pages. LimitTag: string?,-- The name of the tag to send the limit for non-standard pages. SortOrderTag: string?-- The name of the tag to send the sort order for non-standard pages. ) → PageCursor Constructs a PageCursor object. This is used within the library, but it can be used yourself.

title: JoinRequest ​
content: </> Client:JoinRequest ( GroupId: Group | number,-- The Group or GroupId that join request is for. UserId: User | number,-- The User or UserId that made the join request. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → JoinRequest Constructs a JoinRequest object.

title: Authenticate ​
content: </> Client:Authenticate ( Cookie: string-- The cookie to authenticate the client with. ) → () Authenticates the client, once authenticated the client cannot be deauthenticated.

title: Request ​
content: </> Client:Request ( Method: string,-- The HTTP method to use. Endpoint: string,-- The target URL. Tags: {[string]=any},-- Optional tags (querystrings) to add to the request. Headers: {[string]=any},-- Optional headers to add to the request. Body: {[any]=any}-- Optional body to send with the request. ) → ( boolean,-- If the request was successful (code 200) {[number | string]=any},-- The body of the response. {[string]=any}-- The headers of the response. ) Makes a HTTP request with the client's Cookie and X-CSRF-TOKEN.

Tags: {[string]=any},-- Optional list of tags to add on to the request. Interpret: function,-- The function that interprets recieved data, to turn it into a useable format. SortOrder: string?,-- The sort order to use when requesting for pages. Can be "Asc" or "Desc". Limit: number?,-- The page item limit to use when requesting pages.
